cons:

If you have ambitions, it is incredibly difficult to rise up in a company that pretends to give everyone a fair shot while mostly playing favorites.
Advice to Management
Managers have tough jobs to run their departments well while keeping employees satisfied and happy. Too often they tend to gloss over the realities of the business with false promises of skyrocketing careers and opportunities. All too often I have heard managers deceptively counseling their employees with false promises that if they only wait it out just a LITTLE bit longer they'll have their shot at promotion and growth. It's understandable that the business relies on low wages and flexible hours to operate, but that is not what we are told when we go into the job. Just be upfront about the expectations and realities of working for Marriott. You are underpaid at the bottom, and if thats ok with you then you maybe can have a shot at a decent paying job higher up.

review_title: One of the funnest jobs I’ve ever had, very easy to move up in the company.
pros: I liked it because coworkers are so nice, but what can you expect working in hospitality? They have a lot of meetings for us where they provide snacks and just fun things for employees like contests. It’s very easy to move up in the company, I was promoted three times in 2 years, hospitality also looks great on your resume. I consider myself an introvert and it really helped me get out of my shell even though some days were hard.
cons:
The pay is okay. Compared to other phone operating jobs, $13.25 is fairly low especially for the things we have to put up with. The company claims to be all about treating the employees right but managers will easily override restrictions they shove down our throat just to make a guest with status happy. I’ve told guests no many times only for a manager to cave in and say yes, this makes the guests with status entitled little brats who know they can get what they want if they just ask for a manager and give us a hard enough time. Some of the people at the top seem to have no idea of the challenges that come with hospitality. Hospitality is “the customer is always right” times a billion and it gets hard. I was one of the many employees who was furloughed and while I know hospitality was hit especially hard because of COVID-19, it sucked not knowing where I was going to get my next paycheck or pay. I think they should’ve helped a little with that since they claim to take care of the employees. Also if there’s a manger who makes a lot of money for the company yet is horrible to the employees with the HR reports to prove it, they won’t do anything. All they care about is their pockets.
Advice to Management
Stick to the rules despite the status of the guests. It’s very disheartening when we enforce the rules that are put in place only for management to give in as soon as the guest asks them for it. I understand that guests of status contribute to the hotel a lot but the way they speak or act with employees is sometimes unacceptable, very disrespectful and we just need y’all to have our backs. Show that you really are all about taking care of your employees.
